title: Collaborative Online Mathematics Content Design Workshop for Pre-Service Teachers: A Social Science Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level expertise and extensive practical experience in the field, foundational understanding of education design from a social science perspective
context.additional_context: Strengthening practical mathematics education design competencies linked to learner roles (leader/manager). Special emphasis is placed on educational designs fostering social relationships and civic consciousness.

learning_goals: Learners design a mathematics lesson module that promotes collaborative problem-solving in remote environments, integrating strategies to facilitate social interaction among students.

Learners apply at least three strategies (discussion facilitation, role allocation, feedback loops) to promote student-led inquiry activities in real-time online discussions, focusing on civic competency enhancement.
Learners establish a feedback system for developing mathematical thinking in LMS-based asynchronous activities, incorporating peer relationship-building and collaborative problem-solving processes.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
